review: I was prescribed 5 mg of Crestor 18 months ago for high cholesterol. My story is much like everyone else’s on this site. I was 68 years old when I started this medication, in good health, active, exercising regularly and at a normal body weight. Gradually, I began noticing back pain, hip and leg pain. At first I thought it was just due to the ageing process, but the pain continually increased, where I could hardly stand up from a sitting position. I was laying on a heating pad each night to try to sooth the discomfort. It was hard to lay in one position very long. I went to an orthopedist, thinking my hips must be severely arthritic. I was eating Motrin like candy. He said my hips were fine. Each time I went walking 2 miles, the pain increased, so I stopped exercising.  My neck became stiff and the range of motion turning my head was impaired. It was hard to drive looking behind me. I was having frequent dizziness. I stopped the Crestor, 7 days later, I was better.

I was on this medication off and on for a year.  I finally took myself off due to horrible side effects.   My Dr told me I had no choice but to go back on it so I took her advice and restarted the med.  It lasted for TWO DAYS before I realized why I went off of it the 1st time.The muscle aches/pain and fatigue were HORRIBLE.  My quality of life took a nose dive in only 48 hrs.  I have come to realize that Doctors aren't always right, and most are there to push legal poison (medication) without looking at healthy alternatives.  I have adopted a new way of eating (Mediterranean diet) and started to exercise more often. I also do intermittent fasting for 16-20 hrs.  My numbers aren't great but they're a lot better than they used to be, plus I have quality of life. I'm going to find a new Dr and continue to educate myself on healthy alternatives to some medications.   I realize some are absolutely necessary, but I will say.....be proactive with YOUR life and do your research.

It went of in day time but came back two hours after tablet every night, all night. Then after day three stiffness and pain in knees also.  Is it worth it? I feel desperate.

It’s one of the scared things that have ever happened to me, just trying to sleep, and every couple of seconds, I’d wake up gasping for air, almost starving for it. Mind you I’m 48.
